Chapter 1: Refuting Permanence, Part 1: Refuting Permanence. All things arise as effects, therefore they have impermanent natures;
Therefore, except for the Buddha, there is no one who can be called a TathÄgata in reality.
There is no time, place, or thing that has a nature that is not produced by conditions;
Therefore, there is no time, place, or thing that has a nature that is permanent.
There is no nature without a cause, and with a cause it is not permanent;
Therefore, the desire to establish a cause-less nature is said to be non-existent by true insight.
Seeing that what is produced is impermanent, one considers what is not produced to be permanently abiding;
Since one sees that impermanence exists, one should say that the nature of permanence does not exist.
Foolish people falsely discriminate, considering space and so forth to be permanent;
The wise, relying on the world, also do not see this meaning.
It is not the case that a single existent part pervades all parts;
Therefore, we know that each part has a possessor.
If the substance of dharmas really exists, then contraction and expansion can be obtained.
This samÄdhi arises from others, so it becomes the produced effect.
If apart from the produced effect, there is no producing cause,
Then the producing cause all becomes the produced effect.
All dharmas must change before becoming the cause of another arising;
How can such a changing cause be said to be permanent?
If originally non-existent and now existent, it naturally becomes the cause forever;
Since it is already admitted to be natural, the cause is then falsely established.
How can one rely on permanence and give rise to impermanence?
The characteristics of cause and effect are not the same, and this has never been seen in the world.
If one part is the cause and the other parts are not the cause,
Then it should become various, and because of being various, it is not permanent.
In the cause, the subtle and round characteristics, in the effect, then do not exist;
Therefore, all the subtle atoms, are not the all-pervading combination.
In the place of one subtle atom, if one does not allow there to be the other,
Therefore, one also should not allow the cause and effect to be of equal measure.
If the subtle has the east, it must have the eastern part;
If the subtle atom has a part, how is it the subtle atom?
Requiring to take the front and abandon the back, only then can one speak of it as movement;
If these two are non-existent, the mover should not exist.
The subtle atom has no initial part, the middle and final parts also do not exist;
This then is that all the eyes, are all unable to see.
If the cause is destroyed by the effect, this cause is then impermanent;
One may allow the effect and cause, the two substances to be in different places.
One does not see there are any dharmas, that are permanent and yet have resistance;ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Therefore, the ultimate atom is permanent, and the Buddhas have never said otherwise.
Apart from the bound and the binder, there is no true liberation;
Because the function of production is lacking, even if it exists, it is also called non-existent.
At the time of ultimate nirvana, there are no aggregates and no self;
Not seeing the one who attains nirvana, based on what is there nirvana?
At that time, I abandon all virtues, apart from love, what thought is there?
If there is a self without thought, then it is used without anything.
Without the seeds of a self remaining, then it can definitely produce thought;
Only when there is no self and no thought, then all existence is non-existent.
If there is a self apart from suffering, then there is definitely no nirvana;
Therefore, within nirvana, self and so forth are all eternally extinguished.ğŸ”½It is better to seek within the world, not to seek in the supreme truth;
Because in the world there is a little, in the supreme truth there is none at all.
Chapter 2: Refuting the Self The inner self is truly neither male, nor female, nor neither;
But only due to ignorance, it is called a man.
If in the great elements there are no male, female, or neither,
How can the great elements give rise to male and so forth?
Your self and others are not my self, therefore my self has no fixed characteristics;
Isn't it that in the impermanent, one falsely discriminates and takes it as a self?
The self is the same as the body, with changes occurring in each birth;
Therefore, it is not reasonable that the self exists apart from the body and is permanent.
If a dharma is without contact, then it does not move;
Therefore, bodily actions are not created by the life principle.
The self is always not harmed, so why bother cultivating the cause of protection?
Who fears eating diamonds, holding a staff to guard against many pests?
If there is recollection of past lives, one would consider the self to be permanent;
Since one sees the marks of the past, the body should also be permanent.
If the self combines with thought and transforms into thought,
Thought should also not be thought, so the self is not permanent.
The self combines with pleasure and so forth, various like pleasure and so forth;
The self is like pleasure and so forth, therefore it is not one and also not permanent.
If one says the self and thought are permanent, relying on auxiliaries to form a false grasp;
Just as it is said the fire is permanently abiding, then it does not rely on firewood and so forth.
Just as when reaching cessation, the moving object has no function there;
Therefore the existence of the self without thought, its principle is not accomplished.
Thought arises in other directions, thought is seen in a separate place;
Just as an iron mass melts away, the essence of the self should transform and be destroyed.
Thought is small like the measure of the mind, the self is large like empty space;
Only observe its own characteristics, then one does not see thought.
If the self's virtues are all-pervading, why do others not experience them?
Since the obstruction is said to be universal, it should not only obstruct one thing.
If virtues are all-pervading, how can one create everything?
One should be together with madness, deluded and accomplishing nothing.
If virtues can skillfully understand the creation of houses and other things,
but do not know how to enjoy them, is this not unreasonable?
There is movement and impermanence, empty and unobstructed without movement;
Uselessness is the same as non-existence, why not rejoice in non-self?
Or observing the self as all-pervading, or seeing its extent as the same as the body,
Or grasping it as like an atom, the wise understand it to be non-existent.
Eternal dharmas cannot be harmed, why abandon harm for liberation?
Therefore, the idea that the self is eternal and attains liberation is unreasonable.
If I truly had a nature, I should not praise the transcendence of self;
One who definitely knows the truth, should realize that the path to liberation is empty.
If there is no self in liberation, then it should not exist before either;
The seen without admixture, one should know that is its true nature.
If the impermanent is all cut off, then why not grass and so forth?
This principle, even if it were true, ignorance would also not exist.
Clearly seeing the functioning of form and so forth, arising and ceasing from conditions;
Therefore, one knows that your grasping of self, though existent, is non-existent.
Just as sprouts and so forth are formed from conditions, seeds and so forth are born from conditions;
Therefore, all impermanent dharmas, are produced by the impermanent.ğŸ”½Because dharmas arise from conditions, therefore their substance is not cut off;
Because dharmas cease from conditions, therefore their substance is also not permanent.
Chapter 3: Refuting Time If pots and so forth are in the future, they are not past or present;
If they exist in the future and present, they are not future.
If the future has already ceased, yet has the substance of the future,
Then it would always be future, how could it become past or present?
If dharmas are in the future, with the characteristics of the future present,
They should be the present, how can they be called future?
If the past and future exist like the present, why is there no function of taking effects?
If the substance is always not non-existent, why is it not permanently abiding?
If the past is past, how does it become past?
If the past is not past, how does it become past?
If the future has arising, why is it not the present?
If the future has no arising, why is it not permanently abiding?
If the future has no arising, and is impermanent because of destruction,
Since the past is already destroyed, why not call it permanent?
The present world is impermanent, not because of the past, etc.;
Except for these two destinations, there is no third.
If future activities have a predetermined substance,
One who speaks of a person with a predetermined nature should not be a heretic.
If a dharma arises from causes and conditions, it does not have a substance that precedes it;
If it has a substance that precedes it and arises, it should arise again after arising.
If one sees the existence of the past and future, why does one not see non-existence?
Since one sees the existence of the past and future, one should not say they are distant.
If the unproduced dharma exists, the cultivation of precepts, etc. would be in vain;
If there is a little something to be done, the result is not existent beforehand.
Since activities are impermanent, the result is not always existent;
If there is initial existence and subsequent existence, the world would commonly acknowledge impermanence.
One should not be diligent in liberation, liberation has no past or future;
Or perhaps there is past and future, then craving should be separate from the one who is free from craving.
If one holds that the effect exists before, and constructs a palace and ornaments,
The pillars and so forth would be useless;
The same is true if the effect did not exist before.
The wise have never seen any transformation of dharmas;
Only ignorant people falsely discriminate and say it exists.ğŸ”½How can there be abiding in impermanence?
If abiding has no substance,
If there were abiding from the beginning, later there should be no change or decay.
Just as there is no single consciousness that can cognize two meanings,
In the same way, there is no single meaning that can be cognized by two consciousnesses.ğŸ”½If time has remaining abiding, abiding then does not constitute time;
If time has no remaining abiding, later cessation should not exist.
If the dharma is different from impermanence, then the dharma is not impermanent;
If the dharma is the same as impermanence, then the dharma should not abide.
If impermanence is initially weak, then the power of abiding should definitely be strong;
What is the reason for these two being seen as inverted later?
If impermanence is weak in the essence of all dharmas,
Then there should be no abiding at all, or everything should be permanent.
If impermanence always exists, then the characteristic of abiding should always be absent;
Or those dharmas should be permanent first, and then later become impermanent.
If dharmas are together with impermanence, and yet one says there is abiding,
Then the characteristic of impermanence should be false, or the characteristic of abiding should be empty.
Seeing what is not seen, turning the mind to a false object;
Therefore, there is only a false memory called arising.
Chapter 4: Refuting Views Those who receive the teachings from a teacher with the aspiration for supreme wisdom should be known as Dharma vessels;
Those who are not like this, both teacher and student, have no cause for attaining victory.
Speaking of existence and the causes of existence, purity and the means of purity,
The world itself does not understand, how can the faults be in the Sage?
Abandoning all existence and nirvana is commonly accepted by non-Buddhist schools;
The emptiness of true nature refutes everything, why are they not delighted by it?
Not knowing the cause of abandoning and realizing, there is no way to abandon and realize;
Therefore the Sage says that apart from the coolness of nirvana, there is definitely no other.
If one gives rise to doubt regarding the profound matters spoken by the Buddha,
One can rely on the signless emptiness and give rise to definitive faith.
Contemplating the present, there is still delusion, knowing the future will definitely be false;
All those who rely on those teachings and practices will be deceived without end.
The wise one attains nirvana by himself, and is able to do what is difficult to do;
The foolish one encounters a good guide, but has no mind to follow and enter.
Not knowing the state of fearlessness, the state of complete knowledge is also like this;
Certainly due to partial knowledge, one gives rise to fear.
The Dharma of the current of birth and death, the foolish one always practices;
Never cultivating the current against the stream, therefore one gives rise to fear.
All those foolish people, obstructing others' true view;
There is no way to be born in a good realm, how to attain nirvana?
It is better to violate the precepts, not to damage right view;
The precepts give rise to a good realm, right view attains nirvana.
It is better to give rise to the view of self, not the view of emptiness and no-self;
Later, one is born in an evil realm, at first only turning one's back on nirvana.
The wonderful principle of emptiness and no-self, the true realm of the buddhas;
Able to frighten all evil views, seeing the non-dual gate of nirvana.
The foolish hear the name of the empty Dharma, all giving rise to great fear;
Like seeing a powerful person, the timid all flee in terror.
Although the Buddhas have no intention, they speak the Dharma of destroying other's arguments;
Yet other arguments are destroyed by themselves, like wild fires burning firewood.
Those who awaken to the true Dharma, definitely do not delight in deviant teachings;
For the sake of others' false gates, they reveal the meaning of true emptiness.
If one knows the true emptiness and no-self principle spoken by the Buddha;
In accordance with it, one does not give rise to joy, and in disagreement, one has no fear.
Seeing the many non-Buddhist groups, for the most part, are causes of meaninglessness;
Those sentient beings who delight in the true Dharma, who would not deeply sympathize with them!
The Brahmins and Jains, the three schools of the Tathagata;
The ear, eye, and mind are able to know, therefore the Buddha's Dharma is profound and subtle.
The doctrines of the Brahmins often lead to deception and fraud;
The teachings of the Jains mostly conform to foolishness.
Respecting Brahmins is for reciting various scriptures;
Having pity on the Jains is because they torment their bodies.
Just as suffering is the result of karma, not the cause of true liberation;
An excellent body born from karma is also not the means to attain liberation.
In brief, the Buddha taught that only his teachings possess these two distinctions;
Non-harming leads to rebirth as a human or god, while contemplating emptiness leads to the realization of liberation.
Worldly people are attached to their own doctrines, just as they love their native land;
The true Dharma can destroy [false doctrines], but the non-Buddhist parties do not rejoice.
The wise who seek excellent qualities should believe and accept the true doctrine;
The true Dharma is like the sun, and those with eyes can see it.
Chapter 5: Refuting the Senses and Objects, Part 5 Within the parts of a vase, only color is visible;
Saying the entire vase is visible, how can one understand the truth?
Those with superior wisdom, according to the meaning stated before,
Should refute all categories of smell, taste, and touch.
If one only sees the color of a vase and says one sees the vase,
Since one does not see smell and so forth, one should be called not seeing the vase.
Obstructed forms are not entirely visible,
Their parts and the middle are obstructed by these parts.
The existence or non-existence of the most subtle parts should be carefully considered;
Citing non-existence as evidence, the meaning will ultimately not be established.
All obstructed phenomena are composed of many parts;
Words and letters are also like this, therefore they are not grasped by the senses.
Apart from manifest color, how can one apprehend shaped color?
If one apprehends shaped color based on manifest color, why not do so based on the body?
Apart from color, the cause of color should not be seen by the eye;
Since the natures of the two dharmas are different, why are they not separately observed?
The body perceives hardness, etc., and together establishes the names of earth, etc.;
Therefore, only within contact is the distinction of earth, etc. spoken of.
When the production of what is seen in a pot is seen, no different virtue is seen;
The essence is produced as seen, therefore its true nature is completely nonexistent.
The eye, etc. are all derived from the great elements, why does the eye see and not the others?
Therefore, the results of karma are difficult to conceive, the Sage truly speaks.

If one goes after seeing, going would be useless;
If one goes without seeing, one should not definitely wish to see.
If one observes without going, one should see all forms;
Since the eye has no movement, there is no distance and no obstruction.
The essence, characteristics, and function of all dharmas must be the same before and after;
How is it that this eye faculty does not see the nature of the eye?
There is no form or consciousness in the eye, and there is no eye in consciousness;
The two are both absent within form, so how can it see form by combining?
If what is heard can express, why does it not become non-sound?
If sound is not able to convey meaning, why does it give rise to understanding when conditioned?
If sound is heard by reaching the ear, how can one understand the original sound?
Sound has no sudden explanation, so how can it be fully understood?
Even up to what is not heard, it should not be the nature of sound;
Before nonexistence and later existence, the principle is definitely not in accord.
If the mind is apart from the faculties, going should also be without function;
If it is like this, the life principle should always be without mind.
Causing the mind to mistakenly grasp objects, relying on past seeing like a mirage,
Mistakenly establishing the meaning of dharmas, this should be known as the aggregate of conceptualization.
Eye, form, etc. are the conditions, like an illusion producing various consciousnesses;
If grasped as truly existent, the analogy of an illusion would not be established.
All that exists in the world, none are not difficult to fathom;
The principle of faculties and objects is the same, why would the wise be surprised?
All dharmas are like a fire wheel, transformations, dreams, illusions,
Water moon, comet, echo, mirage, and floating clouds.
Chapter 6: Refuting Extreme Attachments If dharmas truly exist, they should not depend on others to be established;
Since they must depend on others to be established, it is definitely known that they do not truly exist.
There is no vase in the form, and there is no vase apart from the form;
There is no form dependent on the vase, and there is no vase dependent on the form.
If one sees the two aspects as different, namely that the vase exists apart from the form,
Since the two aspects are already distinct, there should be difference apart from the vase.
If the one is not called a vase, the vase should not be called one;
The vase and one have never been combined, the vase should not have a single name.
If the form pervades the real, the form should be able to obtain the great name;
If the opponent's argument is not from another, he should present his own doctrine.
There are number and other characteristics, but the characterized is not established;
Apart from this, there is no other cause, therefore dharmas do not exist.

Therefore, dharmas such as form cannot be combined to form a pot.
Form is one part of the pot, therefore the substance of form is not a pot;

The nature of all form and so forth, the characteristics of form and so forth are without difference;
Only one kind is a pot, the others are not, what principle is there?
If form is different from taste and so forth, but not different from pots and so forth;

Since pots and so forth are already without causes, their substance should not result in fruits;
Therefore, if they are different from form and so forth, pots and so forth are definitely non-existent.
If the causes of pots and so forth exist, they can be the causes of pots and so forth;
If the causes of pots and so forth do not exist, how can pots and so forth be produced?
When form and so forth are combined, they never become smell and so forth;
Therefore, the combined single substance should be like pots and so forth, non-existent.
Just as the substance of a pot is truly non-existent apart from form and so forth,
The substance of form should also be like this, non-existent apart from wind and so forth.
Heat is precisely the nature of fire. How can that which is not hot burn?
Therefore, the substance of firewood is non-existent. Apart from this, fire does not exist.
Because other heat is mixed, how can it not be fire?
If the other is not accomplished as heat, then by the principle of fire, it should be non-existent.ğŸ”½If the fire particle has no firewood, then fire should exist apart from firewood;
If the fire particle has firewood, then there should be no fire particles.
When carefully contemplating all dharmas, not a single substance truly exists;
Since a single substance does not exist, multiple substances should also be non-existent.
If a dharma has no other [parts], you consider it to be a unitary substance;
All dharmas have the three natures, therefore a unitary substance is non-existent.
Existence, non-existence, both existence and non-existence, neither existence nor non-existence, one, and not one, both negated,
Should be assigned in order, the wise understand they are not real.
In the imputed dharma of continuity, the false views of all true permanence;
In the accumulated imputed dharma, the wrong attachment says it really exists.
All dharmas are formed from various conditions, by nature weak and without independence;
Falsely relying on others to establish, therefore self and dharmas are all non-existent.
The effect is formed by the combination of various conditions, apart from the conditions there is no separate effect;
In this way, the combination and the effect, all sages understand as non-existent.
Consciousness is the seed of all existence, the object is what consciousness cognizes;
When seeing the object as without self, then all the seeds of existence are extinguished.

Since the two and the one are already non-existent, how can the one exist?
It is not that production occurs only from one's own nature apart from the nature of another;

The future also does not arise from the past or present.
If complete, there is no coming; having ceased, it should not go;
The essence of dharmas is like this, the illusions, etc., are not false.

Before and after are also non-existent, how can one grasp them as existent?
If the characteristics of arising, etc., have further arising, etc.,
Abiding and ceasing should be like arising, or arising and abiding should be like ceasing.

The four possibilities of non-difference are the same, or it is completely non-existent.

The time of production is different from the two states, there should be a separate intermediate.

Then there should be a remainder, the time of obtaining can be seen.
If it reaches the stage of having already arisen, it is logically impossible for there to be a time of arising;
If that which has already arisen has a time of arising, how could it arise from that?
If it is posited as the time of arising before reaching the stage of having already arisen,
Why not say that it is not a pot?
Because that which has not yet arisen is no different.

The later stage is said to have it;

Excluding this stage of existence and non-existence, who would say it is the time of arising?ğŸ”½Those who hold that apart from the cause,ğŸ”½There is no separate effect to be produced;

Relying on the principles and teachings in the previous chapters, one should again dispel them.

If dharmas are originally empty by nature, what merit is there in seeing emptiness?
The bondage of false discrimination, the view of emptiness can eliminate it.
If dharmas are established as one or non-existent, it contradicts both truth and convention;
Therefore, existence and non-existence are different, and both cannot be spoken of.
Existence, non-existence, both existence and non-existence, all tenets are extinguished;
